p: Three experiments were separately conducted. In each experiment, two groups of 10 and nine mice received 200 μl containing 2 × 10 8 colony forming units (CFU)/mouse of L. paracasei CNCM I-1518 or 200 μl PBS (control), respectively, daily by oral gavage. Mice were infected by intranasal infection with IAV on day 0 with 50 μl H3N2 virus (260 plaque forming units, PFU) as previously described [ 15]. For this purpose, mice were first anesthetized by intraperitoneal injection with a mixture of xylazine and ketamine (MERIAL, Villeurbanne, France). Seven days after IAV infection (day 7), mice were superinfected in the airways with N. meningitidis (10 7 CFU/ mouse in 50 μl of a bacterial suspension at 2 × 10 8 CFU/ml). The infection was performed by the strain LNP24198lux, a serogroup C strain belonging to the hyperinvasive clonal complex ST-11 [ 17]. The infection was followed by dynamic imaging until 48 h after bacterial infection (Fig. 1a) as previously described [ 18]. Oral gavage with L. paracasei CNCM I-1518 was performed during the entire period of viral and secondary infection.
